graph.coarsening

Class Coarsener

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.coarsening.Coarsener
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CoarsenerIEC, CoarsenerIREC

    public abstract class Coarsener
extends java.lang.Object
    base class for coarsening graphs, which is useful in problems such as graph partitioning. None of the methods are thread-safe; the class itself is not thread-safe and must be protected for concurrent use under a multi-threading context.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2017

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      • Coarsener

        public Coarsener(Graph g,
                 int[] partition,
                 java.util.HashMap properties)
        base coarsener constructor.
        Parameters:
        g - Graph
        partition - int[] partition[i] must be in {1,...,k} where k is the number of required partitions
        properties - HashMap may be null

    • Method Detail

      • getCoarseGraph

        public Graph getCoarseGraph()
                     throws CoarsenerException
        return the coarse graph resulting from an invocation of the coarsen() method.
        Returns:
        Graph the coarser graph
        Throws:
        CoarsenerException - if graph has not been coarsened yet

      • getOriginalGraph

        public Graph getOriginalGraph()
        return the original graph.
        Returns:
        Graph

      • getPartition

        public int[] getPartition()
        return the partition array, specifying a partition of original node ids, among k components. The range of the map is in {1,...,k}. Notice that the exact data member is returned, so changes to the elements of the returned array are directly reflected to this object's _graphPartition data member.
        Returns:
        int[]

      • getCoarseNodeId

        public int getCoarseNodeId(int finegraphid)
        return the coarse-node id of the node of the fine-level graph with given id.
        Parameters:
        finegraphid - int the id of the fine-level (original) graph
        Returns:
        int
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if finegraphid doesn't exist or if coarsen() hasn't been called yet.

      • getFineLevelNodeIds

        public java.util.Set getFineLevelNodeIds(int coarsegraphid)
        return the set of fine-level node ids that correspond to the coarse level graph node with id the given id.
        Parameters:
        coarsegraphid - int the id of the coarse-level graph
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Integer> that may be null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if coarsen() hasn't been called yet.

      • setPartition

        public void setPartition(int[] arr)
        set the partition array to the input argument. The array must have exactly as many elements as the original graph has nodes, and the values of the elements must be in {1,...,k} where k is the number of partitions required.
        Parameters:
        arr - int[]

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Object

                        java.lang.Object obj)

      • coarsen

        public abstract void coarsen()
                      throws GraphException,
                             CoarsenerException,
                             ParallelException
        the main method of this class. Sub-classes must implement this method.
        Throws:
        GraphException
        CoarsenerException
        ParallelException

      • newInstance

        public abstract Coarsener newInstance(Graph g,
                                      int[] partition,
                                      java.util.HashMap properties)

      • reset

        protected void reset()
        resets this object so it may be reused in another coarsening for the same graph. Does NOT reset the _graphPartition array data member.
